t: For the choir director. A psalm of the sons of Korah.
Lord,*spn you showed favor to your land; you*ln restored the fortunes of Jacob.
You*ln forgave your peopleâ€™s guilt; you*ln covered all their sin. Selah*ig
You*ln withdrew all your fury; you*ln turned from your burning anger.
Return*pn to us, God of our salvation, and*ln abandon your displeasure with us.
Will*ln you be angry with us forever? Will*ln you prolong your anger for all generations?
Will*ln you not revive us again so*ln that your people may rejoice in you?
Show*ln us your faithful love, Lord,*s and*ln give us your salvation.
I*pn will listen to what God will say; surely*ln the Lord*s will declare peace to*ln his people, his faithful ones, and*ln not let them go back to foolish ways.
His*ln salvation is very near those who fear him, so*ln that glory may dwell in our land.
Faithful*pn love and truth will join together; righteousness*ln and peace will embrace.
Truth*ln will spring up from the earth, and*ln righteousness will look down from heaven.
Also,*ln the Lord*s will provide what is good, and*ln our land will yield its crops.
Righteousness*ln will go before him to*ln prepare the way for his steps.
